filmography.title: Dark City
filmography.role_description: A cynical gambler who becomes the target of a vengeful psychopath after a game goes wrong; Heston's professional film debut.
filmography.plot: A bookie is hounded by a vengeance-crazed psychopath after he takes $5,000 from a sucker in a fixed poker game.

filmography.title: The Greatest Show on Earth
filmography.role_description: The tough, no-nonsense manager of a traveling circus who prioritizes the show above his personal life and romance.
filmography.plot: The dramatic lives of trapeze artists, a clown, and an elephant trainer are told against a background of circus spectacle.

filmography.title: Ruby Gentry
filmography.role_description: A wealthy young man who spurns a poor girl to marry for money, igniting a vengeful fury that destroys them both.
filmography.plot: A poor North Carolina girl is rejected by the local gentry but ends up marrying the town's wealthiest man.

filmography.title: The President's Lady
filmography.role_description: The future President of the United States, portrayed as a fiery young lawyer defending the honor of his wife, Rachel.
filmography.plot: Andrew Jackson defends his wife's honor against slanderous attacks regarding her previous marriage as he rises to the Presidency.

filmography.title: The Naked Jungle
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, stubborn cocoa plantation owner in South America who battles a massive army of soldier ants.
filmography.plot: A South American plantation owner attempts to hold off a river of killer ants from destroying his land.

filmography.title: Secret of the Incas
filmography.role_description: A rugged, cynical adventurer seeking a gold treasure in Peru; the character's look directly inspired Indiana Jones.
filmography.plot: An adventurer searches for an Incan treasure in the Andes while competing with a rival and guiding a refugee.

filmography.title: The Ten Commandments
filmography.role_description: The Hebrew prince turned prophet who defies Pharaoh and parts the Red Sea to lead his people to freedom.
filmography.plot: Moses discovers his Hebrew heritage and leads his people out of Egypt, facing the wrath of Pharaoh and dissent among his followers.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Effects; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Touch of Evil
filmography.role_description: A righteous Mexican narcotics officer who clashes with a corrupt American police captain in a border town.
filmography.plot: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in a Mexican border town.

filmography.title: The Big Country
filmography.role_description: A rough ranch foreman who constantly challenges the pacifist newcomer, Gregory Peck, over the love of their boss's daughter.
filmography.plot: A New Englander arrives in the Old West, where he becomes embroiled in a feud between two families over a valuable patch of land.

filmography.title: Ben-Hur
filmography.role_description: A Jewish prince betrayed into slavery by his Roman friend, who fights for his freedom and vengeance in the chariot arena.
filmography.plot: After a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent to slavery by a Roman friend in 1st-century Jerusalem, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: El Cid
filmography.role_description: The legendary Spanish hero who drives the Moors from Spain while trying to unite a divided country.
filmography.plot: The fabled Spanish hero Rodrigo Diaz (El Cid) overcomes a family vendetta and court intrigue to defend Christian Spain against the Moors.

filmography.title: 55 Days at Peking
filmography.role_description: A U.S. Marine major who leads the defense of the foreign legations in Peking during the Boxer Rebellion.
filmography.plot: Diplomats, soldiers, and other representatives of a dozen nations fend off the siege of the International Compound in Peking during the 1900 Boxer Rebellion.

filmography.title: Major Dundee
filmography.role_description: An obsessive Union officer who leads a ragtag group of soldiers, prisoners, and scouts into Mexico to hunt Apaches.
filmography.plot: During the American Civil War, a Union officer leads a mixed force of Union troops, Confederate prisoners, and scouts on a punitive expedition against Apaches in Mexico.

filmography.title: The Agony and the Ecstasy
filmography.role_description: The tormented Renaissance artist who battles Pope Julius II over the painting of the Sistine Chapel ceiling.
filmography.plot: The biographical story of Michelangelo's troubles while painting the Sistine Chapel at the urging of Pope Julius II.

filmography.title: The War Lord
filmography.role_description: A medieval Norman knight who claims 'Droit du Seigneur' over a village maiden, inciting a local rebellion.
filmography.plot: A knight in service to a duke goes to a coastal village where an earlier attempt to build a defensive castle has failed.

filmography.title: Khartoum
filmography.role_description: The eccentric and deeply religious British general who defends the city of Khartoum against the Mahdi's army.
filmography.plot: British General Charles Gordon defends Khartoum against the forces of the Mahdi, a Sudanese religious leader.

filmography.title: Planet of the Apes
filmography.role_description: A cynical astronaut who crash-lands on a future Earth ruled by intelligent apes, delivering one of cinema's most famous final lines.
filmography.plot: An astronaut crew crash-lands on a planet in the distant future where intelligent talking apes are the dominant species.

filmography.title: Will Penny
filmography.role_description: An aging, illiterate cowboy who finds a brief chance at love and family while protecting a woman from outlaws; Heston's personal favorite role.
filmography.plot: An aging cowboy on a cattle drive discovers a woman and her son living in his line shack, and must protect them from a gang of ruthless outlaws.

filmography.title: Julius Caesar
filmography.role_description: The loyal Roman general who delivers the famous 'Friends, Romans, countrymen' speech to turn the tide against Caesar's assassins.
filmography.plot: The assassination of Julius Caesar and its aftermath, featuring an all-star cast in a Shakespearean adaptation.

filmography.title: The Omega Man
filmography.role_description: A military scientist who is the last human survivor of a biological war, fighting nocturnal mutants in Los Angeles.
filmography.plot: Army doctor Robert Neville struggles to create a cure for the plague that wiped out most of the human race.

filmography.title: Soylent Green
filmography.role_description: A police detective in a dystopian, overpopulated future who uncovers the horrifying secret behind the world's food supply.
filmography.plot: In the world of 2022, as the Earth is overpopulated and totally polluted, a police detective uncovers the secret behind the synthetic food that keeps the population fed.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Win – Best Science Fiction Film

filmography.title: The Three Musketeers
filmography.role_description: The scheming and powerful Cardinal who manipulates the King and plots against the Musketeers.
filmography.plot: A young swordsman comes to Paris and faces villains, romance, adventure, and intrigue with three Musketeer friends.

filmography.title: Earthquake
filmography.role_description: A construction engineer who tries to save his estranged wife and others when a massive earthquake destroys Los Angeles.
filmography.plot: Various people struggle to survive when a major earthquake hits Los Angeles.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Sound; Oscar: Special Achievement (Visual Effects)

filmography.title: Airport 1975
filmography.role_description: A pilot who is dropped from a helicopter into the cockpit of a damaged 747 to fly the plane to safety.
filmography.plot: A 747 is struck by a small plane, leaving the flight crew dead or incapacitated, and a stewardess must fly the plane until help arrives.

filmography.title: Midway
filmography.role_description: A naval officer who helps plan the Battle of Midway while dealing with his son's forbidden romance.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the battle that was a turning point in the Pacific Theater of World War II.

filmography.title: Tombstone
filmography.role_description: A wealthy rancher who provides shelter and support to Wyatt Earp and his posse during their vendetta ride.
filmography.plot: A successful lawman's plans to retire anonymously in Tombstone, Arizona are disrupted by the kind of outlaws he was famous for eliminating.

filmography.title: True Lies
filmography.role_description: The eyepatch-wearing director of the Omega Sector intelligence agency, a nod to Nick Fury.
filmography.plot: A fearless, globe-trotting, terrorist-battling secret agent has his life turned upside down when he discovers his wife might be having an affair.

filmography.title: Hamlet
filmography.role_description: The leader of the traveling acting troupe who performs the play-within-a-play to catch the conscience of the King.
filmography.plot: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarried to the murderer, his uncle.
